Klaus Mueller.description: still working on his research paper at the library (conversing about how Klaus Mueller and Eddy Lin plan to incorporate elements of jazz music and African American literature into their poetry reading event to uplift diverse voices, promote inclusivity, engage with marginalized communities, prioritize accessibility, and showcase a variety of talent from different cultural backgrounds, including Black LGBTQ+ individuals, while collaborating with local organizations and businesses to amplify underrepresented voices.) @ the Ville:artist's co-living space:common room:common room sofa

Ayesha Khan.description: attending classes at Oak Hill College library (conversing about Ayesha Khan and Wolfgang Schulz are discussing the inclusion of workshops, spoken word performances, collaborations with Black-owned businesses and LGBTQ+ organizations, and the importance of diversity and inclusivity at their poetry reading event.) @ the Ville:Dorm for Oak Hill College:common room:common room table

Eddy Lin.description: working on their composition project at Oak Hill College (conversing about how Klaus Mueller and Eddy Lin plan to incorporate elements of jazz music and African American literature into their poetry reading event to uplift diverse voices, promote inclusivity, engage with marginalized communities, prioritize accessibility, and showcase a variety of talent from different cultural backgrounds, including Black LGBTQ+ individuals, while collaborating with local organizations and businesses to amplify underrepresented voices.) @ the Ville:Oak Hill College:classroom:classroom podium
